sentence.Network_en: They stumble across a ghost town inhabited by a rascally gold prospector.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们偶然来到一个居住着一位狡诈的淘金者的废墟之城。

sentence.Network_en: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

sentence.Network_en: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只是绊了一下，周围就变成了一片黑暗。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Old Norse, from the Germanic base of stammer

entry.tran: 绊脚;跌跌撞撞地走;踉跄;步履蹒跚
entry.def: If you stumble, you put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running and nearly fall over.

example.ex: I stumbled into the telephone box and dialed 999.
example.tran: 我跌跌撞撞地进了电话亭拨了 999。

entry.tran: (朗读或说话时)结巴，磕磕巴巴
entry.def: If you stumble while you are reading aloud or speaking, you make a mistake, and have to pause before saying the words properly.

example.ex: ...his voice wavered and he stumbled over the words at one point.
example.tran: 他声音颤抖，一度说话磕磕巴巴的

sentences.sentence: "he recited the whole poem without a single trip"
"he arranged his robes to avoid a trip-up later"

means.word_mean: 2. miss a step and fall or nearly fall;

sentences.sentence: "I stumbled across a long-lost cousin last night in a restaurant"
"She slipped up and revealed the name"

sentences.cn: 她被一块石头绊了一脚。
他讲每句话都结结巴巴。

jushi.english: She stumbled around until she was taken home.
jushi.chinese: 她蹒跚地走着,直到有人把她带回家。
有个醉汉跌跌撞撞地从我们身边走过。

jushi.english: The tired old man stumbled along.
jushi.chinese: 这疲倦的老人蹒跚前行。
